intro: Receveura, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly rough texture. Receveura is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and natural habitats across parts of Asia and North America.
